Stem:
A 12-week weight loss program reports that the average participant who completed the program lost 30 pounds. Suppose the program is not actually effective but also that the effect was not by chance.

 How could the reported average weight loss be so high?

ScenarioDefinition.Observed_Outcome: Average weight loss among completers is high (30 pounds).
ScenarioDefinition.Constraint: The program is not very effective for most people.

ThemeRegistry.description: Participants who were not losing weight were more likely to drop out. Their data is excluded, biasing the average of the completers upward (Attrition Bias).
The people who completed the program were the most motivated or disciplined, and this motivation (rather than the program itself) led to the weight loss.
